title: Galaxy Note 10 Plus review: the luxury phone
description: Samsung Note 10 Plus  here's our review for the king of Android phones. Can it keep the crown, or have all the other, less expensive contenders made it just another phone? The answer to that question, Dieter Bohn says, is simply this: how much would you pay to have a stylus in your phone?   Read more:   Subscribe:  Like The Verge on Facebook:  Follow on Twitter:  Follow on Instagram:   Why'd You Push That Button Podcast:  The Vergecast Podcast:  More about our podcasts:   Read More:  Community guidelines:  Wallpapers from The Verge:   Subscribe to Verge Science on YouTube, a new home base for our explorations into the future of science:
transcript: (slow music) This is the Samsung Galaxy Note 10 Plus. You know the Note, right? It was the first big phone, but now every phone is big. Then, it was the most powerful big phone. But nearly all big Android phones have really great specs now. So what's left for the Note? Samsung will tell you that there are a bunch of things. But really, there's just one thing: the S Pen, the stylus. See, the Note starts at $1,100, which is hundreds of dollars more than comparable phones, even phones that Samsung makes.
